help.label: Tethering
help.summary: Share mobile network connection with other devices

item.title: Wi-Fi tethering
item.contents:
You can turn on Wi-Fi tethering on your device to share its Internet connection with computers or other devices.

- You cannot use device applications to access the Internet via a Wi-Fi connection while the device is tethering via Wi-Fi.

- You can configure portable Wi-Fi tethering in Wi-Fi tethering settings.

item.title: Bluetooth tethering
item.contents:
You can share your device's Internet connection with your computer by tethering them together via a Bluetooth connection.

- Bluetooth tethering works with any computer or device that can access Internet via Bluetooth.

item.title: USB tethering
item.contents:
You can share your device's Internet connection with your computer by tethering them together via a USB cable.

- Tethering works with Windows 7, Windows Vista, and Linux.

- You cannot connect to the device memory or SD card from your computer when it is tethered via USB.
